Transcript: Rafe: My wife. God, I love the sound of that.
Alison: So do I.
Rafe: I wish this could go on forever.
Lucy: Aha. Ok. Ok, how about a Franklin Smith of Liverpool?
Paige: No.

Lucy: All right. Wait a minute. There's an Edna Smith or Charlie -- a Chucky 
Smith.

Paige: Lucy, come on, this is ridiculous! You are not going to find my 
relatives on a genealogy website!

Lucy: You know what? I am because that's exactly how I found my relatives, 
the Koviches.

Paige: Let me rephrase this -- you're not going to find any relatives 
alive. I've told you a hundred times -- I don't have any living family!

Lucy: Yes, you have. You've told ad nauseam. And I've told you the cards tell 
me that ain't so.
Paige: Why is this so important to you?

Lucy: For goodness' sake, I would think this would be obvious. If I do not 
figure out why you're here and what journey you're on, then you are going to 
haunt us for the rest of our lives!
Paige: Oh.
Kevin: What's going on?
Amy: Papa. I'm so glad you're here with me. I need you.

Harris: I tried to tell you, sweetheart. I tried to tell you that Ian 
Thornhart is nothing but a cold, ruthless murderer.

Amy: How could I have been so stupid? He doesn't love me. He never did. He 
just used me, took from me. He took from me the only man that ever really loved 
me.

Harris: And I still love you. My darling, more than ever. Hey, you're still 
my little girl.
Amy: Oh, Papa. I'm sorry.
Harris: Shh. You mustn't worry. There's still time.

Amy: Yes, there is. No one has figured out who I am. They have no idea that 
I'm your daughter. I can still do it, and I will, Papa. I'll make sure that Ian 
Thornhart is dead on your birthday, just like I promised.
Chris: Go on. Open it.

Eve: A picture of Amy and some guy you think is her father -- what's the big 
deal?

Chris: Well, I don't know. But I do know that she wanted to make damn sure 
that nobody saw that picture. And it's my gut feeling that Mr. X -- he's the 
reason why.
Eve: I don't want to see this.
Chris: Well, sure, you do.
Eve: No, I don't. Ian and I are back. We're perfect. We're in love.
Chris: Oh, great. I'm thrilled.
Ian: There she is. I told you we'd find her. You owe me a dollar.
Eve: There's my buddy.
Ian: Hey.
Eve: Hi. Pinch your little pink cheeks.

Ian: The dinner ended abruptly, so I got the kid and thought we'd find you, 
see if you were ready to go home.

Eve: Yes, I'm certainly ready to go home. Are you ready? You've had a long 
day, haven't you?
Ian: Yeah.

Eve: Yes, my buddy. You've had a long day. What do you think? Did you miss 
your mommy? Did you miss your mommy?

Chris: Hey, you know what? I'll hold down the fort here if you want to get 
out.
Eve: Yeah. Ok, thanks. Thanks a lot. Here. Take this.
Chris: Sure.
Eve: Sorry. I dropped that.
Chris: Hey, no problem.
Eve: Get it for me, will you?
Chris: Yeah.
Eve: Bye.

Chris: Bye-bye. And don't bother thanking me. I think you'll be thanking me a 
little bit later.
[Captioning made possible by ABC, Inc., and SOAPnet]
Kevin: So, just what are you doing?

Lucy: Uh -- well, you know, it's really very simple, actually. The cards have 
told me over and over and over again that Paige has some relative, some 
connection here in Port Charles, and I figure for her to complete her journey, 
she has to figure out what that connection is. So I am just simply trying --
Kevin: Just trying to help.

Paige: Well, I'm impressed. I mean, I've been searching day and night for the 
past three months to try and figure out why I'm here. All Lucy has to do is flip 
over a few cards and -- presto -- she has the answer.

Lucy: Yes, I do. And you know what? I don't care if you believe me or not 
because I believe enough for all of us.

Paige: What about you, Kevin? I mean, you don't honestly believe this 
nonsense, do you? Oh, God. Don't tell me --

Kevin: Look, look, I honestly don't know what to believe. I mean, I'm having 
a hard enough time looking at you knowing that you're --
Paige: An angel.
Kevin: An angel, yes.

Paige: Yes, I know, which I'm not fully yet, at least, and I'm not going to 
be if we don't stop looking at these silly cards!
Kevin: But what I have learned is not to underestimate my wife --
Lucy: Thank you.
Kevin: Even though she tends to go overboard once in a while.
Lucy: Doc --

Kevin: Lucy, you need to back off just a little bit. Besides, we all agreed 
what was most important right now is finishing Paige's portrait.

Paige: Yes, and the sooner we finish it, the sooner we'll be able to take it 
home where it belongs and hang it in the hall with the others.
Lucy: Home. Back to London.

Paige: Well, yes, of course. That's where all of the Smith portraits are 
hung.

Lucy: Yes, of course. It's really very simple, isn't it? Good. Paint. Doc, 
that's -- that's what you need to do. You need to paint. Paint, paint, paint -- 
right now. Go ahead.
Kevin: What are you doing?

Lucy: Well, I'm going to sit right here and watch you paint, paint, paint. Go 
ahead.
Kevin: No, you're not.
Lucy: Yeah, I am.
Kevin: No, you're not.
Lucy: Yes, I am.

Kevin: No, you're not, Lucy, because I can't paint and play referee between 
you two. If you want this thing to be finished, you have to leave us alone.

Lucy: Since when did you become Mr. Sensitive Artist? Ok. Ok, fine. I'll just 
be moseying, then.
Kevin: Thank you for understanding.
Lucy: I do understand. You're welcome. But listen --
Kevin: Hmm?
Lucy: Get busy.
Kevin: Ok.
Lucy: Go.
Kevin: Ok. You have to forgive her.
Paige: Mm-hmm. Do I?

Kevin: Come on, give her a break. This has all been a little more than 
amazing for all of us.
Paige: Yes, I know, but --

Kevin: Like I said, Lucy's instincts are not something that I would just 
dismiss out of hand. And who knows -- she might be right. Maybe you are 
connected to someone.

Paige: But who? And why is Lucy so certain that that person is here in Port 
Charles?
Amy: Evening, Chris.
Chris: Now, how did you know I was here?

Amy: Well, snakes make a distinctive sound when they slither across the 
floor.
Chris: That's very cute.
Amy: Hmm. Why are you staring at me?
Chris: Not really staring. I was just thinking.
Amy: Heaven help us.
Chris: You remember a while back how you issued that little challenge for me?
Amy: "Challenge?"
Chris: Yeah, you know, discovering your secrets, uncovering the truth.
Amy: Oh, what a relief. I thought you had forgotten it.

Chris: No, on the contrary, I've been working rather hard on it. Discovered 
interesting things, too.
Amy: The proverbial dog with a bone. So, what will you fetch me now, rover?
Chris: Well, for starters, you really do resemble your father.
Ian: It's a beautiful night.
Eve: Hmm.
Ian: What do you say we sit down and enjoy it? You up for that?
Eve: Yes.
Ian: Come on, little man.
Eve: Kind of in a strange mood tonight, aren't you?
Ian: Yeah, I guess I am.
Eve: Does it have anything to do with your dinner with Amy?
Ian: I screwed up.
Eve: What'd you do, Ian?

Ian: I failed to mention to her that the reason I asked her out to dinner was 
to tell her that you and I are back together. And then when you didn't show up, 
she got the wrong idea.
Eve: Great.

Ian: You know, and I know where she's coming from as well because the last 
time I talked to her, our marriage was on the rocks. And then I asked her to 
dinner, said we should talk.
Eve: And she thought that you were going to leave me for her.
Ian: I'm so stupid.

Eve: No, no, no, no. Listen, that was her fantasy all along. It's ok. So, 
how'd she take it when you told her the truth?
Ian: Was a wee bit embarrassed. But in the end she wished us well, I think.
Eve: Well, good. Now she can move on. Come here, buddy.
Ian: Just think I could've handled it better, that's all.

Eve: You're my bud. You know what? She is a strong woman, Ian. She'll move 
on.

Ian: Yeah. She's leaving in a few days to start her life over, start a new 
life --
[Daniel cries]
Eve: Oh, come here, sweetheart. Oh.
Ian: Dropped your purse.
Eve: Oh.

Kevin: Paige, whatever your journey is, I'm sure you'll find it. And I have 
to believe that whatever that is, it must be something worthwhile.
Paige: Me, too.
Kevin: Somehow I believe that I must be connected to it.
Paige: I used to believe that, but --

Kevin: For a reason. Look, you came to Port Charles. Your first instinct was 
to come to me.
Paige: That's because I wanted to see you one last time.
Kevin: I'm glad you did.

Paige: Even though I've been this dark cloud hanging over your family ever 
since I got here?

Kevin: No, look, Paige, my close call was my own fault. And Christina's just 
a little girl who happened to get sick.

Paige: Yes, and me, the angel of death, ready to take both of you over to the 
other side.

Kevin: But you didn't. That wasn't your purpose. But I'm sure that finishing 
your portrait will lead you there somehow.
Paige: You're very sweet to say that.

Kevin: I mean it. And I'm sorry that you were taken before you had a chance 
to do everything you wanted to do.
Paige: Don't be sad.

Kevin: You were my friend, Paige. My best friend. And I'm just so sorry that 
you died.
Kevin: Well --

Alison: I have never been happier than I am at this very moment. I want to 
tell all of our friends and I want to -- I want to shout it from the rooftops 
that I am your wife and you're my husband.

Rafe: So you're really not disappointed that we didn't have a real wedding 
with all the trimmings?

Alison: What? No. No, this was as -- as real and as beautiful as any wedding 
could get when two people are really, truly in love.
Rafe: I couldn't have said it better myself.

Alison: Thank you. But there just was one little thing that I wish maybe 
would've been different.
Rafe: What?
Alison: I mean, our friends weren't here to celebrate it with us.

Rafe: Oh, yeah. Lucy would've loved this. And Serena -- she would've gone 
nuts over the whole thing.

Alison: Yeah, and Livvie and Jack, they would've loved it, and my nana -- I'm 
so sorry -- my grandmother -- she would've loved it.
Rafe: Hey. You know what? Why don't we have a big wedding after all?
Alison: What?
Rafe: Yeah, that would be great. I could meet your parents.
Alison: Oh, yeah, I -- I wouldn't bet on that.
Rafe: What do you mean? They'd have to come.

Alison: Yeah. They would really try. But I'm sure that my dad would get 
called away on business or something to London on an emergency trip. And my mom, 
she -- she really loves Paris this time of the year. I'm sure it would be really 
hard for her to get away.
Rafe: Come on, they can't be that bad.

Alison: No, they're not. They're not -- they're not terrible people at all. 
They're -- they just should've never have had a child.

Rafe: Don't they know what they're missing? Don't they know what an 
incredible, amazing, beautiful daughter they have -- a daughter that could bring 
them so much happiness if they would just let her? They can't know. Otherwise 
they could never stand to leave her any more than I can.
Ian: You dropped this.

Eve: Oh. Oh, thanks. Just put it back in my purse. It's ok, sweetie. Huh? Oh, 
goodness, you just wanted to be with your mommy and daddy, didn't you?
Ian: That's when he's happiest --
Eve: Yes, you did.
Ian: When it's just the three of us.
Eve: That reminds me. Here.
Ian: Come here. What?

Eve: I have something. A surprise for you. Well, actually, it's for all of 
us. I'll open it for you.
Ian: Ok. What does she have?
Eve: Yay. Ok, here we go. o/~ Ha, la, la, la, la o/~
Ian: What is that, a brochure of some kind of a resort or something?

Eve: Oh, Ian, it's the most wonderful resort in the whole world. White sandy 
beaches. It's beautiful. And, best of all, they love kids.
Ian: A vacation.
Eve: You, me, and Danny -- the three of us -- what do you say?
Ian: I say, "When do we leave?"
Eve: Yes.
Ian: Because no one deserves fun in the sun more than the Thornharts, right?
Eve: Yay! The Thornharts' first family vacation! Yay!
Ian: It's also our honeymoon, isn't it?
[Eve sighs]
Ian: What's wrong?
Eve: Nothing. Everything's perfect.
Ian: Give me a kiss. And it's going to stay that way. Isn't it, Lambert?
Eve: I love you so much.
Ian: I love you. Not just for one night.
Eve: For always.
Ian: Yeah. What do you think, little man?
Eve: And I love you.
Amy: How would you know I look like my father?

Chris: Well, you remember that little snapshot I told you about? The one 
taken in Philadelphia? The one you claim you weren't in? Well, it turns out that 
was a father/daughter weekend.
Amy: So?

Chris: So I could only assume that the man standing behind you, looking so 
admiringly at you, was your -- was your dear, old dad. I mean, the image was 
kind of blurry and I couldn't quite make it out, but then I got the idea -- hey, 
why not have it blown up and digitally enhanced? You know, it's amazing what 
computers can do these days.
Amy: This is crazy.

Chris: You know what? I believe the word here is "gotcha." Ok? Now, let's add 
up what we know. Well, your name can't be Stradling because you had a necklace 
on that said "A.H." And whoever old man H is -- well, he must've been a real 
S.O.B. for you to be so ashamed to let anyone know that you're related to him.

Amy: I am not ashamed of my father! He was a wonderful and brilliant man, and 
he loved me. He's a hundred times the man that you'll ever be.
Chris: Huh. Seems I struck a nerve.
Amy: I want that picture, Chris.
Chris: Why?

Amy: I would like somebody I can trust to take a look at it for me. That's 
obviously the only way you're going to get off my back.

Chris: Ok. Sure, no problem. I'll give you the picture. But wait a minute. 
There is a problem. I can't give you the picture because it's already in Eve 
Lambert's purse. I put it there.
Amy: You did what?

Chris: Yeah. See, I don't think she really knows about it just yet, but she 
will find it soon enough.
[Pager beeps]

Chris: Oh, that's me. I got to run. Hey, this is -- this has been a lot of 
fun. You have a nice night.
Paige: Is it -- is it finished?
Kevin: Come and have a look.

Paige: Oh, Kevin. It's -- I don't know how to describe it. It's even -- it's 
even better than I dreamed of.
[Lucy gasps]

Lucy: Oh, Doc, it's beautiful. It -- it's beautiful. I knew you could do it. 
I knew you could.

Paige: I don't know how to thank you. Finally my portrait will hang in the 
family gallery. Finally I'm going home.
Lucy: Well, correction. We're going.
Paige: What?
Lucy: All three of us -- we're going to London.
Paige: What are you talking about?
Kevin: Lucy, I -- I thought you wanted this be finished. It is now.

Lucy: I do, I do, but it's not quite finished. Paige, this -- this huge 
ancestral home of yours where you want to hang your portrait -- does it have, 
like, a family archive, a history, a Bible, or something like that?
Paige: Yes, of course. Why?

Lucy: Because I know that we're going to find out your connection to someone 
here in Port Charles right the at your home. I can feel it. We'll find out why 
you're here.
Paige: Lucy --
Kevin: Lucy, wait.
Paige: I told you --

Lucy: No. No, wait. No. This isn't up for discussion. This isn't a request. 
Look, you dropped out of the clouds, out of nowhere, right into my family's 
life. You disrupted everything. I was very accommodating. I don't know how many 
wives would put up with their husband's old lovers hanging out in an attic with 
them, you know? Especially somebody that came from heaven. So I want to go back 
with you. I want to see your journey completed. That's the least you can do. So, 
Doc, come on, pack your bags. We're going to London.

Rafe: Yeah, hi. My name's Rafe Kovich. I'm a friend of Alison's. Actually, 
I'm a very good friend. Yeah. Listen -- there's something I need to do for her, 
ok?
Ian: Hey.
Eve: Huh. Well, maybe the light bulb burned out.
Ian: Can't be. I just replaced it.
Eve: That's strange. I wonder what happened, then.

Jamal: You're done.
Jack: No, I'm not done.
Ricky: And all of a sudden you know everything about dying?
Casey: Yeah, I do. Ok, I know everything about it.
Eve: Ian, I told you not to sneak up on me like that.
